steps.notes: Extract ilmenite from regolith; yields generated in process.

recipe_def.assumptions: Extraction yields ~0.6 kg ilmenite per 1 kg regolith input; tailings ~0.4 kg.
recipe_def.notes: In-situ ilmenite extraction from regolith; placeholder yields and mass balance.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for ilmenite extraction from regolith

steps.notes: Extract carbon reductant from carbonaceous regolith feedstock.

recipe_def.assumptions: Carbonaceous regolith feedstock available for small-scale carbon recovery.
recipe_def.notes: ISRU extraction route for carbon reductant; drying and sizing steps deferred.

steps.notes: Hall-Héroult electrolysis at ~960°C. Very energy-intensive (15 kWh/kg)

inputs.notes: Aluminum oxide extracted from highland regolith
Flux to lower melting point (~90% recycled)

recipe_def.assumptions:
Hall-Héroult process produces aluminum suitable for structural applications.
Cryolite flux is 90% recyclable. Carbon anode consumption rate is 0.5 kg per kg aluminum.
Energy requirement: 15 kWh/kg is realistic for electrolytic aluminum production.
recipe_def.notes:
Aluminum alloy ingot production via Hall-Héroult electrolysis from alumina.

This is the standard industrial process for primary aluminum production.
Extremely energy-intensive (15 kWh/kg output) but enables local aluminum
production from lunar highland regolith.

Process chain from regolith:
1. Highland regolith (100 kg) → alumina extraction → 12 kg alumina
2. Alumina (2 kg) → Hall-Héroult smelting → 1 kg aluminum ingot
3. Therefore: ~17 kg regolith → 1 kg aluminum ingot

Replaces placeholder recipe that incorrectly used generic melting/casting.

Form steel motor housing from iron. 19.2 kg iron → 18 kg housing + 1.2 kg scrap.

steps.notes: Crush and grind coarse regolith to powder
Extract oxygen and produce metal byproduct via MRE

recipe_def.assumptions: Co-product metal alloy from MRE; refining not modeled.
Cast small races; machine and finish to bearing dimensions; finishing not modeled yet.
recipe_def.notes: Coarse local route for bearing_set_small; refine with grinding/finishing in a future update.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for bearing_set_small (v0)

recipe_def.notes: Recipe to manufacture silicon_powder_v0 via grinding silicon metal v0.
Base recipe linking the silicone_precursor_synthesis_v0 process to the silicone_precursor product.
recipe_def.name: Silicone precursor synthesis recipe v0

steps.notes: Synthesize silicone polymer from precursor materials

recipe_def.notes: Base recipe linking the silicone_polymer_synthesis_v0 process to the silicone_polymer product.
Link coil insulation material to production process coil_insulation_production_v0 to resolve no_recipe gap.

steps.notes: Forge rough blank from steel stock bar or billet to approximate shaft shape
Turn and bore to bearing journals and keyway features
Final tolerances and surface finish on shaft bearing surfaces

recipe_def.assumptions: Use steel stock bar or billet; final motor shaft geometry matches journal and keyway specs; tolerances defined by machining_finish_basic_v0
recipe_def.notes: Basic motor shaft manufacturing path; adjust as design details are refined
recipe_def.name: Motor shaft (steel) – basic v0

steps.notes: Stamp stator/rotor laminations from electrical steel.
Wind copper coils for stator (and rotor if wound rotor) per design.
Assemble laminations, shaft, bearings, housing, and terminal box; perform basic spin test.

recipe_def.assumptions: Uses stamped laminations; bearings imported; motor_final_assembly_v0 to be detailed.
recipe_def.notes: Small electric motor assembly (0.5-2 kW class).
